quest.name: The Great Horn Heist Redux
journal:
Ollier can't help but get the sense that something is eating away at you.
※This quest is available for a limited time only.

You share with Ollier your lingering doubts that your prior investigation arrived at the whole truth behind the matter of the stolen horn. Convinced that the true culprit remains at large, Ollier agrees to persuade Master Roland to reopen the case, that justice might at last be served. Armed once more with your trusty inspector's journal, you head out once more into the halls of the Saucer, vowing that this time no clue will escape you.

※Please note that you will be unable to complete this quest after the seasonal event has ended. For details, please check the Lodestone.

Having gleaned all that you can from your survey of the Saucer and questioning of its denizens, you share your deductions before a tribunal headed by Master Roland, and once again, a verdict is rendered. You then set out to speak once more with Ollier, that you might hear his thoughts on the outcome.
You speak with Ollier, who expresses his thanks for your diligent efforts on Hugue's behalf. With the case at last brought to a conclusion, you bid the Saucer attendant farewell and take your leave.
objectives: Search the Gold Saucer for clues, and speak with Ollier to discuss them.

dialogue.name: OLLIER
dialogue.text: Oh, it's you again. Is everything quite all right? You look as if there's something on your mind...

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: It's nothing, really...

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Let me investigate once more!

dialogue.name: OLLIER
dialogue.text: Forgive me...I did not mean to presume. Thank you again for your aid with our investigation, and do enjoy the festivities.

dialogue.name: OLLIER
dialogue.text: You wish to conduct another investigation? I admire your diligence, but─for better or for worse─the case is already closed...

dialogue.name: OLLIER
dialogue.text: That said, if there is a chance that true justice has not been served, we would be remiss not to rectify matters.

dialogue.name: OLLIER
dialogue.text: I will explain the situation to Master Roland and Captain Daluce and arrange for another hearing to be held. In the meantime, pray survey the premises and collect whatever evidence you can. We're counting on you, friend!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Should you choose to undertake this quest, know that guidance from the journal, duty list, and map will be limited. You will need to read the text carefully and decipher the clues to determine your course of action.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Scattered throughout the Gold Saucer are clues that will aid you in uncovering the identity of the thief. Obtain them by speaking to the denizens and customers of the Gold Saucer, and investigating any suspicious items or locations.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: All information gleaned in your inquiry may be reviewed at any time by checking your inspector's journal, which can be accessed at any time from the Key Items menu. Use your resources well, and see that the true culprit is brought to justice for their crimes!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: When you believe you've gathered all the information needed to crack the case, speak with Ollier. From there, you will have a chance to share your deductions and prove the accused innocent.

dialogue.name: DALUCE
dialogue.text: Conducting another investigation, you say? Be my guest, though I'll be a chocobo's uncle if anything comes of it!

dialogue.name: HUGUE
dialogue.text: How many times must I say it? I swear to you, I am innocent!

dialogue.name: SASAPANO
dialogue.text: We all know you did it. Why not confess and save us all some trouble?

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You inquire regarding any information potentially related to the incident in question...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You carefully survey the area...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Unsure whether or not the information you have gleaned will avail you, you nevertheless choose to record it in your journal.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You've already gleaned all there is to know from this place...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Your search has yielded all the pieces of the puzzle. It is now up to you to put them together.

dialogue.name: STAFFA04056
dialogue.text: I was tasked with selling Mini Cactpot tickets, and was standing behind the counter at the time of the crime. To think that something like this could happen here at the Gold Saucer!

dialogue.name: STAFFA04056
dialogue.text: I said the same to Captain Daluce and Pipimaya─ah, they're the two Brass Blade officers questioning Hugue over there─but I don't recall anything out of the ordinary at the time.

dialogue.name: STAFFA04056
dialogue.text: It was festival season, however, so our halls were even more crowded with customers than usual.

dialogue.name: STAFFA04056
dialogue.text: Yet I guarantee you that no unauthorized persons were allowed to slip behind the counter. From my vantage point, I would have noticed in an instant if that were the case.

dialogue.name: GUESTA04056
dialogue.text: That Hyuran attendant, you say? If I recall, he left his post for a time to escort a customer some place or another.

dialogue.name: GUESTA04056
dialogue.text: Thought it odd to see no one manning the counter, but I suppose it happens from time to time? Or perhaps not...

dialogue.name: BRASSBLADESMANB04056
dialogue.text: Given its sheer size, we believe the thief has hidden the stolen horn somewhere around the premises until such time as they can arrange to smuggle it out. Though, for the life of me, I can't find the godsdamned thing anywhere...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You have the sense that something currently hidden to your gaze was visible from a different angle. Or are you simply imagining things...?

dialogue.name: STAFFB04056
dialogue.text: Oh, whatever to do? Whatever to do!?

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The Lalafellin attendant seems terribly flustered, and not particularly inclined to carry on a conversation. Perhaps if you knew precisely what has him in such a huff, he might be persuaded to listen...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You inquire about the missing uniform...

dialogue.name: STAFFB04056
dialogue.text: Shush! Have you lost your wits!? Don't say that so loud! If anyone heard that I'd misplaced my uniform, why there'd be hells to─oh, I should probably quiet down, myself.

dialogue.name: STAFFB04056
dialogue.text: Needless to say, those uniforms are issued to official Gold Saucer staff alone. When not wearing them, we're instructed to guard them as if our lives depended on it. If it were to get out that I lost mine...

dialogue.name: STAFFB04056
dialogue.text: Just before, I checked with the cleaning staff to make sure that it wasn't accidentally disposed of somehow.

dialogue.name: STAFFB04056
dialogue.text: The man said he'd seen nothing, nor have any articles of clothing been delivered to the lost and found. Oh, wherever could my uniform have gone!?

dialogue.name: BRASSBLADESMANC04056
dialogue.text: The investigation? Hah. We already know that sorry wretch named Hugue did it. I've got more interesting matters to think about.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The Brass Blade doesn't seem inclined to listen to you at the moment. Perhaps if you knew of a rumor that might pique his interest...

dialogue.name: BRASSBLADESMANC04056
dialogue.text: The investigation? Hah. We already know that sorry wretch named Hugue did it. I've got more interesting matters to think about. Say, have you heard any good rumors lately?

dialogue.name: BRASSBLADESMANC04056
dialogue.text: Pipimaya flat-out ignored a friendly invitation and went off to the chocobo races alone, you say? That's somethin' you don't hear every day...

dialogue.name: BRASSBLADESMAND04056
dialogue.text: Never known the man to say no to anyone. Why, one time a new recruit started calling him “Mayapipi,” and he didn't even bat an eyelash. On the contrary, he just went along with it like it was his new favorite nickname!

dialogue.name: BRASSBLADESMAND04056
dialogue.text: Since then, all the newcomers have taken to calling him “Master Mayapipi,” and Pipimaya's as happy as a chocobo gettin' scratched behind the ears! To think he'd turn a deaf ear to one of his subordinates─that's a juicy rumor if I ever heard one!

dialogue.name: STAFFC04056
dialogue.text: Have I noticed anything out of the ordinary, you ask? Well, now that you mention it─I doubt it has anything to do with the incident, but...

dialogue.name: STAFFC04056
dialogue.text: My colleague who mans the Cactpot Board mentioned that his uniform had gone missing. I could scarce believe it─the man's a veteran, and as careful as anyone I know.

dialogue.name: STAFFC04056
dialogue.text: We're instructed to guard those outfits with our lives, you know. If my colleague doesn't find his soon, Master Roland is like to give him a chewing out like he'd never believe...

dialogue.name: BRASSBLADESMANE04056
dialogue.text: Around the time the robbery happened, I was just getting off active duty. I had a mind to go to the chocobo races with Pipimaya, so I gave him a yell. But would you believe it? He just walked off to the racetrack as if he never heard me!

dialogue.name: BRASSBLADESMANF04056
dialogue.text: Pipimaya, you say? I'd heard his brother was known to place a few coins on the birds from time to time, but never knew Pipimaya had an interest as well.

dialogue.name: BRASSBLADESMANF04056
dialogue.text: Still, for a friendly chap like ol' Pipimaya to just ignore you like that...reckon he must have had a big bet on his mind, eh?

dialogue.name: STAFFD04056
dialogue.text: Have you met Pipimaya? He's one of the Brass Blades investigating the theft for us, but he's no stranger to the Gold Saucer. Why, I've seen him at the chocobo races more than once!

dialogue.name: STAFFE04056
dialogue.text: You sure that's not his brother? They're the spitting image of each other, and I hear it's the brother who's a regular patron here. They say he can rack up the MGP like you wouldn't believe...

dialogue.name: STAFFD04056
dialogue.text: His brother, you say? Why, I didn't even know he had a brother! From what I saw, they could almost be twins!

dialogue.name: STAFFE04056
dialogue.text: Hah! Someone needs to get around a bit more, it seems. Anyhow, the brother's a regular here if I ever saw one. Seeing the sheer single-minded devotion with which he attacks those games, I reckon he's got his eyes on an exclusive prize.

dialogue.name: OLLIER
dialogue.text: How fares the investigation, my friend? You look as if the whole matter still has you a bit puzzled. Have you gotten any closer to the truth?

dialogue.name: OLLIER
dialogue.text: Ah, there you are. Observing from afar, I couldn't help but notice just how thorough you've been in your investigation. Pray tell, do you believe you've arrived at the truth?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: It's all clear to me now!

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: I'm not entirely sure...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The conclusion of this quest will differ depending on the choices you make in the following sequence. However, the rewards will remain the same.

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: Are you ready to explain your reasoning?

dialogue.name: OLLIER
dialogue.text: Truly? In that case, by all means let us share your deductions with the others!

dialogue.name: OLLIER
dialogue.text: I see. Pray take the time you need to be certain, but please hurry...lest poor Hugue be forced to confess to a crime which he did not commit.

dialogue.name: ROLAND
dialogue.text: Ollier has explained the situation to me. Though it is rather...unconventional to reopen a case in this manner, we have a responsibility to arrive at the truth in whatever way that may be done. As such, I will listen once more to all evidence─old and new─at hand, and see what conclusion it leads us to regarding this unfortunate incident. I trust you have no objections?

dialogue.name: DALUCE
dialogue.text: Not as such, Master Roland. While I am skeptical that anything new will come to light, it would not be my place to refuse.

dialogue.name: ROLAND
dialogue.text: MistressMaster Surname, I hear that you have diligently prepared for these proceedings. Are you ready to present your new evidence?

dialogue.name: ROLAND
dialogue.text: Very well, then let us begin. Captain Daluce, pray summarize the details of the incident for those of us who may have forgotten.

dialogue.name: DALUCE
dialogue.text: Gladly. A few bells ago, a Sabotender Emperador horn went missing from the Gold Saucer's prize vault, located behind the main counter. It was noticed by a sharp-eyed attendant whose shift followed that of Hugue.

dialogue.name: DALUCE
dialogue.text: Thorough questioning of all witnesses in the area at the time revealed that no other persons─attendant or customer alike─were seen behind the counter at the time.

dialogue.name: DALUCE
dialogue.text: Investigating our records, we further learned that Hugue was arrested once for petty theft before being employed here at the Saucer. We have named him a primary suspect, and an interrogation is being conducted as we speak. That is all.

dialogue.name: ROLAND
dialogue.text: Thank you, Captain Daluce.

dialogue.name: ROLAND
dialogue.text: MistressMaster Surname. Ollier has informed me that you, too, have been investigating the matter on our behalf. Have you any objections to Captain Daluce's testimony?

dialogue.name: Q3
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: The true culprit is still out there!

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: What proof do you have that Hugue did it?

dialogue.name: DALUCE
dialogue.text: What!? How could you possibly know that!?

dialogue.name: Q4
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A4
dialogue.text: There's always a true culprit!

dialogue.name: A4
dialogue.text: Call it a hunch, I guess...?

dialogue.name: A4
dialogue.text: One of the attendant's uniforms has gone missing!

dialogue.name: DALUCE
dialogue.text: As I just explained, our witnesses stated clearly that they saw no one go behind the counter. In the absence of any other potential suspects, it only stands to reason that Hugue is the culprit.

dialogue.name: DALUCE
dialogue.text: ...At any rate, it's clear you are simply stalling for time. If you have nothing of import to contribute, I daresay it's time we rendered a verdict.

dialogue.name: DALUCE
dialogue.text: What's this you say...!?

dialogue.name: ROLAND
dialogue.text: ...Oho. Then let us proceed to the next topic at hand. Captain Daluce and his men are all but convinced that Hugue is the thief. Have you uncovered any evidence to lead you to believe otherwise?

dialogue.name: Q5
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A5
dialogue.text: Just look at those innocent eyes!

dialogue.name: A5
dialogue.text: He says he didn't do it!

dialogue.name: A5
dialogue.text: If you're so sure he did it, then where is the horn?

dialogue.name: DALUCE
dialogue.text: It's true that we haven't recovered it yet, but I assure you it's only a matter of time. That's hardly evidence of the man's innocence. What exactly are you implying?

dialogue.name: Q6
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A6
dialogue.text: I'm not sure, but it was worth a shot.

dialogue.name: A6
dialogue.text: I propose...the horn just vanished into thin air!

dialogue.name: A6
dialogue.text: The horn was stolen while Hugue was still on duty!

dialogue.name: ROLAND
dialogue.text: ...MistressMaster Surname. My valued employee's good name and future are on the line today. I ask you to take these proceedings more seriously.

dialogue.name: DALUCE
dialogue.text: Hah! You expect that baseless blathering to carry any weight here? It's more than evident that you're just wasting our time.

dialogue.name: ROLAND
dialogue.text: ...I see. For you to say so with such confidence, I imagine you must have uncovered some convincing evidence, indeed.

dialogue.name: ROLAND
dialogue.text: Well, now. I do believe we've come to the heart of the matter. MistressMaster Surname, if you would...just who do you believe is truly responsible for the crime?

dialogue.name: Q7
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A7
dialogue.text: It's you...Pipimaya!

dialogue.name: A7
dialogue.text: It's...not Hugue, that's for certain!

dialogue.name: A7
dialogue.text: I'm sorry, Hugue. I tried...!

dialogue.name: A7
dialogue.text: It's...Captain Daluce!

dialogue.name: SASAPANO
dialogue.text: (-Pipimaya-)M-Me!? Is this some kind of a joke!? I'm no thief! I'm an officer of the law!

dialogue.name: SASAPANO
dialogue.text: (-Pipimaya-)You'd best have some proof behind these accusations, or I'll have you hauled in gaol faster than you can say “Godbert Manderville!”

dialogue.name: Q8
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A8
dialogue.text: My adventurer's sense is never wrong!

dialogue.name: A8
dialogue.text: Just look at that suspicious look on his face!

dialogue.name: A8
dialogue.text: The stolen uniform was Lalafell-sized!

dialogue.name: ROLAND
dialogue.text: ...I am in no mood for jests, MistressMaster Surname. I'll ask you again, and I expect a serious answer this time.

dialogue.name: DALUCE
dialogue.text: So you would have us believe the true culprit is to be found elsewhere. Have you any evidence to support your words?

dialogue.name: Q9
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A9
dialogue.text: This is all just circumstantial evidence!

dialogue.name: A9
dialogue.text: Let me reconsider the matter.

dialogue.name: ROLAND
dialogue.text: ...I am in no mood for jests, MistressMaster Surname. I'll ask you again, and I expect a serious answer this time.

dialogue.name: OLLIER
dialogue.text: N-No! Say it isn't so!

dialogue.name: DALUCE
dialogue.text: ...I knew it. For all your lofty investigative work, all you've done is prove our case for us.

dialogue.name: DALUCE
dialogue.text: The game's up, Hugue. Now tell us where you hid the horn, or you'll be spending tonight─and many more nights─in the sultanate's darkest gaol.

dialogue.name: DALUCE
dialogue.text: You're not serious...are you?

dialogue.name: DALUCE
dialogue.text: At any rate, it's clear we've been wasting our time. Take the suspect away.

dialogue.name: SASAPANO
dialogue.text: (-Pipimaya-)And so what if it is!? That is proof of nothing! You need only look around you to see that I am far from the only Lalafell in this place!

dialogue.name: Q10
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A10
dialogue.text: But not all have a brother with eyes only for MGP.

dialogue.name: A10
dialogue.text: Come to think of it, he has a point...

dialogue.name: A10
dialogue.text: Hmmmmmmmmm...

dialogue.name: SASAPANO
dialogue.text: (-Pipimaya-)Perhaps that man is innocent, but so am I! The thief is still out there! What are you waiting for? Get out there and catch him!

dialogue.name: SASAPANO
dialogue.text: (-Pipimaya-)W-Wait...how do you know that!?

dialogue.name: SASAPANO
dialogue.text: (-Pipimaya-)I mean...nonsense! I have an alibi! At the time the theft happened, I was at the chocobo races! And I'll have you know I won myself a fortune as well! Hah! The joke's on you!

dialogue.name: SASAPANO
dialogue.text: (-Pipimaya-)Just ask any of the attendants there! They all remember me! Why, I'm one of their best customers!

dialogue.name: Q11
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A11
dialogue.text: My most sincere apologies, Master Mayapipi.

dialogue.name: A11
dialogue.text: Lies! Be a man and confess to your crime!

dialogue.name: SASAPANO
dialogue.text: (-Pipimaya-)Why should I confess to something I have not done!? This is an outrage! You're trying to frame me to cover up for your own failure of an investigation!

dialogue.name: PIPIMAYA
dialogue.text: (-???-)Yes, precisely as we orchestrated...

dialogue.name: OLLIER
dialogue.text: In summary, to this point I have not seen sufficient evidence to convict the suspect Hugue beyond a shadow of a doubt. Would you not concur?

dialogue.name: DALUCE
dialogue.text: ...I do. Loath as I am to admit it, your adventurer friend here has raised legitimate concerns.

dialogue.name: DALUCE
dialogue.text: My apologies for being so hasty in accusing the poor man. I shall have him released immediately.

dialogue.name: DALUCE
dialogue.text: That said, the question remains─who was the true mastermind behind this theft?

dialogue.name: PIPIMAYA
dialogue.text: (-???-)Yes, precisely as we orchestrated...

dialogue.name: SASAPANO
dialogue.text: (-Pipimaya-)Master Mayapipi? Is this your idea of a joke? The least you could do is have the dignity to call a man by his proper name!

dialogue.name: BRASSBLADESMANC04056
dialogue.text: What? Just the other day you told us that was your favorite nickname!

dialogue.name: PIPIMAYA
dialogue.text: (-???-)Enough, Sasapano. It would seem our game is up.

dialogue.name: PIPIMAYA
dialogue.text: (-Pipimaya Look-alike-)Remarkable sleuthing, if I do say so myself. Of course, you are correct─Hugue is not the culprit.

dialogue.name: PIPIMAYA
dialogue.text: (-Pipimaya Look-alike-)I am. Or should I say, we are...

dialogue.name: BRASSBLADESMANC04056
dialogue.text: M-Master Mayapipi! There's...two of you!?

dialogue.name: DALUCE
dialogue.text: What is the meaning of this!?

dialogue.name: ROLAND
dialogue.text: You'd better have a good explanation for all of us.

dialogue.name: PIPIMAYA
dialogue.text: I am Pipimaya...the real one, that is. The man who was posing as me until our ruse was revealed is my twin brother, Sasapano.

dialogue.name: PIPIMAYA
dialogue.text: We also have another brother, some years younger than the two of us. He's our pride and joy, sharp of mind and fleet of foot.

dialogue.name: PIPIMAYA
dialogue.text: Sadly, one day our dear brother was stricken with a rare, nigh-untreatable malady. He was told he had but moons to live, if that.

dialogue.name: PIPIMAYA
dialogue.text: Needless to say, Sasapano and I were devastated. When the initial shock had passed, we were left with one thought─if we could not save the boy's life, at the very least we could make his biggest dream come true in the precious days he remained with us.

dialogue.name: PIPIMAYA
dialogue.text: Specifically, his dream to one day sail across the heavens on his very own Sabotender Emperador. I knew of his wish quite well, having often observed him eyeing its glorious succulent form longingly from my post on security duty.

dialogue.name: PIPIMAYA
dialogue.text: And so, in hopes of granting our dear sibling's dying wish, Sasapano and I embarked on a single-minded quest to accumulate as much MGP as we could muster. Sasapano, in particular, displayed quite the aptitude for games, and soon became known as one of the Saucer's most successful regulars.

dialogue.name: PIPIMAYA
dialogue.text: The points accumulated rapidly, and in great quantities, but our brother's condition was declining even more starkly. We were racing against time, and seemed destined to lose.

dialogue.name: PIPIMAYA
dialogue.text: So it was that the idea came to us out of sheer desperation. We would use the hustle and bustle of the festival as a cover, sneak behind the counter, and pilfer that which would make one ill-fated man's wildest dreams come true.

dialogue.name: PIPIMAYA
dialogue.text: ...The rest played out exactly as this insightful adventurer deduced. Little did I expect that I'd be found out before I could even sneak the horn past the guards...

dialogue.name: ROLAND
dialogue.text: Indeed. It all makes sense now...

dialogue.name: DALUCE
dialogue.text: My sincerest apologies, good sir. To think that not only did we wrongly accuse you, but that the true culprit─one of them, at least─was one of our own...

dialogue.name: DALUCE
dialogue.text: Using your position and knowledge as a security officer to mastermind such a heinous act...can you two even begin to comprehend the gravity of your crimes? I'll see you rot in the darkest gaol─

dialogue.name: HUGUE
dialogue.text: Wait...I beg of you!

dialogue.name: HUGUE
dialogue.text: Might I be allowed to speak for a moment?

dialogue.name: HUGUE
dialogue.text: I come from a poor family of refugees. Before they graciously hired me as a Saucer attendant, I lived alone with my mother.

dialogue.name: HUGUE
dialogue.text: For years, it was a constant struggle to put food on our plates. We feared that each coming day might be our last. Often, I would hear my mother sobbing at night, unable to hold back the grief and pain she hid inside for her son's sake.

dialogue.name: HUGUE
dialogue.text: One day, her nameday was approaching, and I had a thought. Once─for one day in her life─I would do something that would bring a smile to her face. And so, I got her a ring─or, more accurately, I stole it.

dialogue.name: HUGUE
dialogue.text: I regretted the act almost immediately, but it was too late. I was soon apprehended. I was dismissed from my job as a laborer, and was told I would never find work in this town again.

dialogue.name: HUGUE
dialogue.text: With not even the coin to buy a scrap of bread for tomorrow's breakfast, I fell into utter despair. My life─our lives─were surely over, I was certain. It was then that a kind soul reached out to me.

dialogue.name: HUGUE
dialogue.text: That kind soul was none other than the very man whose gold ring I tried to steal. I speak of the owner of this Gold Saucer, the one and only Lord Godbert Manderville.

dialogue.name: HUGUE
dialogue.text: He made me swear a promise that I would never turn to thievery again, and offered me a position as an attendant here if I would obey. I am far from a wealthy man, but the remuneration has been more than enough to provide my mother and I with a better life than we could have ever imagined.

dialogue.name: HUGUE
dialogue.text: I was deeply wounded, of course, when I was judged by my less-than-upstanding history, and wrongly branded a thief. And I understand all too well that unfortunate circumstances do not justify turning to crime. And yet, hearing Master Pipimaya speak just now, I cannot help but feel for him...

dialogue.name: HUGUE
dialogue.text: And so, I beg of you─for what little that might count for─do not go overly hard on the man.

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: (-???-)Your plea has been heard, my good man.

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: Captain Daluce. If I might have the floor for a moment, I would make a few propositions.

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: Proposition number one: in my capacity as owner of the Manderville Gold Saucer, I hereby gift to Pipimaya and Sasapano's dear brother one Sabotender Emperador, on the house.

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: The horn was a gift, meaning that no theft has taken place here today. Thusly, there is no crime for which you need answer to the authorities.

dialogue.name: Q12
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A12
dialogue.text: Such boundless generosity!

dialogue.name: A12
dialogue.text: Can I have one, too?

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: Ohoho! Needless to say, there is one with your name on it as well, my friend. Simply partake in our games and start saving those points, and it'll be yours before you know it.

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: As for you, Pipimaya and Sasapano. As I said, you need not answer to the authorities for what you did today. You will, however, answer to me.

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: The words of Hugue here speak to me. In that light, I would make my second proposition.

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: To answer for your actions, and repay me for my gift, I propose that you serve a period of community service, to be performed under my direct oversight.

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: Pipimaya, you are to don a Senor Sabotender suit and serve as a caretaker's assistant in the children's ward at Frondale's Phrontistery. There, you will do your best to provide succor and good cheer to the poor children who suffer as your own young brother does.

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: This will, however, require you to undergo strict training until such time as you are able to perform a perfect Senor Sabotender shimmy. Do you accept these conditions?

dialogue.name: PIPIMAYA
dialogue.text: O-Of course, I do! With pleasure, Lord Manderville!

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: Now for you, Sasapano. I daresay your knowledge and expertise regarding all things Gold Saucer rivals almost any in the realm. It would be a shame to let that go to waste...

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: And so, I propose that you serve as a chaperone for those children suffering from symptoms less grave. You will show them about the Gold Saucer, that their hearts may lighten and they might forget their pain for a time.

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: I trust you have no objections, Captain Daluce?

dialogue.name: DALUCE
dialogue.text: I am but a humble sellsword in the Syndicate's employ, Lord Manderville. Any judgment you render, it is my honor and duty to see carried out.

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: Ohoho! Very well, then. I do believe we can now consider this matter closed.

dialogue.name: OLLIER
dialogue.text: Could Hugue indeed be guilty? Despite all the evidence saying as much, I still cannot believe it...

dialogue.name: OLLIER
dialogue.text: At any rate, we may have arrived at a less-than-ideal conclusion, but I thank you for your cooperation nonetheless.

dialogue.name: OLLIER
dialogue.text: I can't thank you enough for absolving dear Hugue of blame. Though it puts me ill at ease to know that the true culprit is still out there somewhere...

dialogue.name: OLLIER
dialogue.text: ...Ah well. I suppose I should count my blessings. I thank you for your cooperation in the matter.

dialogue.name: OLLIER
dialogue.text: Simply incredible! Thanks to your peerless detective work, my dear friend's innocence has been proven, and fair justice has been served to one and all.

dialogue.name: OLLIER
dialogue.text: Lord Manderville granted Pipimaya and Sasapano a brief reprieve before beginning their sentence, that they might deliver the Sabotender Emperador to their brother in person. I can only imagine how his eyes will alight at the sight!

dialogue.name: OLLIER
dialogue.text: Truly, you have saved the day in more ways than one, and all of us here at the Gold Saucer are in your debt. Thank you, my friend!

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What notes will you review?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Notes on the crime scene at the time of the theft.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Testimony from a witness in the area at the time.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Notes from a conversation with a brusque Brass Blade.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: On the appearance of the crime scene from a different angle.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Notes from a conversation with a frantic attendant.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Notes from a conversation with a blabbering Brass Blade.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Notes from a conversation with an astute attendant.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Notes from a conversation with two Brass Blades.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Notes from a conversation with two effusive attendants.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Nothing.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: (-Notes on the Crime Scene-)According to the attendant handling Mini Cactpot tickets at the time, there was nothing particularly unusual about the scene behind the counter before and after the incident, save for the larger-than-usual crowd on hand to take part in the festivities.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: (-Notes on the Crime Scene-)Furthermore, the attendant was certain that no individuals other than fellow staff were seen behind the counter, as it would be instantly and blatantly obvious were a non-uniformed personage to breach this high-security location.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: (-Witness's Testimony-)According to a customer who happened to be observing the counter at the time, Hugue left his post briefly to show a guest around the floor. As far as the witness could see, no other staff came to fill the post during Hugue's absence.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: (-Brass Blade's Testimony-)A sour-tempered sellsword charged with tracking down the stolen horn groused and grumbled that he has searched everywhere for the invaluable object, but cannot find it for the life of him.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: (-Observations from the Crime Scene-)Surveying the general area of the crime scene, you could not help but feel that objects visible from a certain angle might be hidden from sight when viewed from others. Could this be relevant, somehow?

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: (-Words of a Frantic Attendant-)A Lalafellin attendant was in a panic upon discovering that their official uniform─a possession which Gold Saucer staff are instructed to protect with their lives─had gone missing, and has yet to be recovered.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: (-Words of a Frantic Attendant-)He has searched high and low, and asked his fellow staff members if they had seen it, but to no avail. Furthermore, it would seem no missing items have been delivered to the lost and found yet today.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: (-Words of a Blabbering Brass Blade-)A garrulous sellsword shared with you a story about Pipimaya, a senior member of the Brass Blades involved in the investigation. Pipimaya is an amiable fellow nicknamed “Master Mayapipi” by his subordinates. As the man tells it, it is unthinkable that he would ever ignore a friendly greeting.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: (-Words of an Astute Attendant-)The attendant was shocked and surprised to hear of the missing uniform, as the victim is a veteran employee widely known as one of the most careful and circumspect of all the Saucer staff.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: (-Words of Two Brass Blades-)A junior member of the Brass Blades shared his disappointment and dismay at having invited Pipimaya to the chocobo races for some off-duty entertainment, only to have his superior brusquely rush off without even acknowledging the poor newcomer's words.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: (-Words of Two Brass Blades-)Furthermore, his comrade mentioned that Pipimaya has a brother who is known to enjoy himself at the Saucer from time to time.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: (-Words of Two Effusive Attendants-)Some particularly talkative attendants were discussing Pipimaya's brother, a Gold Saucer regular whose single-minded dedication to earning massive quantities of MGP has only intensified as of late. The latest rumors among the staff say that he's set his sights on an invaluable prize.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: (-Words of Two Effusive Attendants-)Furthermore, it would seem the sibling bears a striking resemblance to Pipimaya himself, as one of the employees appears to have confused the two for each other.
